intro: Pyrola petiolaris, commonly known as the slender snowbell, is a low-growing evergreen herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many shrubs and flowering plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in early spring, often before the leaves fully emerge. Its leaves are leathery, elliptical, and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Pyrola petiolaris thrives in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
